Text: We wish all those celebrating a peaceful, joyous Kwanzaa. https://t.co/m1AZvzPcSB

This Christmas, Jill and I were honored to thank a few brave men and women in uniform for their sacrifices this time of year.
 
They're away from their families to protect us. And they have the thanks of a grateful, indebted president. https://t.co/7sIF8qwMRk
From the entire Biden family to yours: Merry Christmas, America.
Just a few finishing touches! Hope you and your loved ones are having a great Christmas Eve. https://t.co/zdCjjRrI9o
‘Twas the night before Christmas. https://t.co/LnfZHtuqRc
RT @FLOTUS: Earlier this year, @StJude welcomed Ukrainian children with cancer to the United States to continue their care. Shortly after t…

There is a certain stillness at the center of the Christmas story: a silent night when all the world goes quiet.
 
And all the clamor, everything that divides us, fades away in the stillness of a winter’s evening.
 
I wish you that peace this Christmas Eve.

This Christmas season, my hope is that we take a few moments of quiet reflection to really look at one another.
 
Not as Democrats or Republicans.
 
But as who we really are: fellow Americans.

The bipartisan omnibus bill has passed – great news for our economy, capping off a year of historic bipartisan progress for the American people.
 
This bill is proof that Republicans and Democrats can come together to deliver for families. I'm ready to sign it into law.

In 2022, we lowered prescription drug prices, health care premiums, and energy costs.

And we didn't skip a beat in making progress addressing some of the greatest challenges of our time, like the scourge of gun violence and the threat of climate change.
This Hanukkah, let us celebrate and re-dedicate ourselves to the spirit of resilience, unity, and permanence. https://t.co/TMfg0o5CTx

The average gas price is now 44 cents below levels when Russia invaded Ukraine.
 
All the increases since the beginning of Russia’s attack have been wiped out.
We'll remember 2022 as the year Made in America became reality again.

Ukraine and the Ukrainian people don’t just inspire us – they inspire the world. 

It was an honor to host President Zelenskyy at the White House. https://t.co/lzxd40Ervv
Going into 2023 strong. https://t.co/KmOGzEDOnR

Today we learned that incomes are up and inflation is down. Welcome breathing room as our economy has been growing.
 
Another reason for optimism as we head into the holidays and the new year. https://t.co/WzCpCNvjI5
This Christmas, you'll pay less to fill up your tank and get home than you did this time last year.

I ran for office to rebuild the middle class and grow the economy from the bottom up and the middle out.

As we look back on 2022 and look to what lies ahead, I can honestly say I've never been more confident about what the American people and the American economy can achieve. https://t.co/ajpgqWyJ0m

As president, I took action to rein in ghost guns, traffickers, and dealers, and signed the first major gun safety law in three decades – helping keep guns out of dangerous hands and investing to combat gun violence.

Now, It's time we ban assault weapons.

That all-consuming, life-altering love and commitment – that’s marriage.
 
And we’ve guaranteed it for all Americans. https://t.co/jLvhAoA8sC

Our work to strengthen our supply chains is paying off with lower costs, stocked shelves, and more presents arriving on time.

We’re making progress this season, and for years ahead.
Taking it all in. https://t.co/CcU7DnNY1v

We've delivered free masks, free tests, and free vaccines.
 
On my watch, Americans aren't facing COVID alone.

Our economy is growing at a strong 3.2% rate.
Unemployment is at a near-record low.
And inflation and gas prices are coming down.

All while rebuilding our infrastructure, supply chains, and manufacturing here at home.

Reasons for optimism as we move into the new year. https://t.co/TeUrVdI2L9
Tune in as I deliver a Christmas address focused on what unites us as Americans and my optimism for the year ahead. https://t.co/4fIeG8dYSK

I urge everyone to follow the warnings of local officials – go to https://t.co/VsGFYDDJSt for more information. I stand ready to help communities with whatever they'll need. https://t.co/eLEi2VoF8b

Tonight, the fourth night of Hanukkah, we honor the timeless miracle of a small band of warriors fighting for their values against a much larger foe.

That story of resilience reminds me of Ukraine. Even in the darkest days of the year – light will always prevail. https://t.co/4Xqavk1zMA

What President Zelenskyy and the people of Ukraine have achieved matters for the entire world. Together, the United States and Ukraine will keep the flame of liberty burning bright.
 
That light – again – will prevail over darkness. https://t.co/sxktF6bmV7

Today marks 300 days since Putin launched an assault on the free people of Ukraine.
 
Today also marks 300 days of the Ukrainian people showing Russia – and the world – their iron backbone, their love of country, and their unbreakable determination to choose their own path.

I had the honor of sitting down with President Zelenskyy of Ukraine.

We've been in communication throughout the war, but it was meaningful to speak in person. I told President Zelenskyy the United States is committed to supporting the Ukrainian people for as long as it takes. https://t.co/l5HwdXmaBW

In Ukraine's fight against Russia's unprovoked, unjustified war, I’m proud to say they have not stood alone.
 
And on my watch, they never will. https://t.co/2RV8dyXHxr

Today, I’m announcing the next tranche of security assistance to Ukraine:

A $1.85 billion package that includes equipment and ammunition contracts. And a Patriot missile battery that we will train forces to operate as part of our efforts to strengthen Ukrainian air defense.
Join President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and me as we hold a joint press conference. https://t.co/O0Rk76qwpd
America welcomes you, Mr. President. https://t.co/emqWCAYaTv

May God bless Franco Harris, a dear friend of 50 years and a great American. https://t.co/YhOYr3a4IM

Together, our Administration created the most manufacturing jobs in nearly 30 years.
 
We're building factories and making products that will allow America to lead the way in manufacturing again.

Thanks to our Administration's investment, more than 7,200 infrastructure projects were announced or are underway across the country this year.

And we’ll reach more than 20,000 projects in 2023.

The folks responsible for constructing these new factories? 
 
World-class, high-skilled Union workers.

I promised to tackle the spike in prices at the pump caused by Putin's war.
 
Since then, we've led the world in oil releases, rallying our global partners to release oil as well.
 
Now, gas prices are at the cheapest levels since June 2021. And I'm not done yet.

In my first days in office, we set the U.S.’s first-ever national conservation goal through my America the Beautiful initiative.
 
The world is following our lead to safeguard at least 30% of global lands and waters by 2030.
 
This is momentous for nature, people, and our planet. https://t.co/bkic6Z2J62

This year’s Hanukkah arrives in the midst of rising and emboldened antisemitism, at home and around the world.
 
I recognize your fear, your hurt. And as your president, I want to make this clear.
 
I will not be silent. America will not be silent.

The story of Hanukkah is one of miracles. It's a story of a small band of warriors fighting for their values to defeat one of history’s most powerful empires.
 
It's the story of a small jar of oil burning brightly for eight days when it should've lasted one. https://t.co/2WgR4amM7m

Join Jill and me as we host a Hanukkah Reception at the White House. https://t.co/p934xzE97k

Our Administration has officially surpassed our roadmap to take 100 actions this year to strengthen energy efficiency standards.
 
These actions will help save American families at least $100 a year through lower energy bills, this winter and beyond.

You know, I think that Messi guy might have a future. 😉 https://t.co/pxk672SiEY

We're building semiconductor factories and other advanced manufacturing right here in America that'll create tens of thousands of good-paying jobs in the years ahead.

Right now, families with two cars driving home for the holidays are saving $200 a month on gas compared to mid-June’s peak.
Thanks to our plan to transition to steady, stable economic growth, inflation slowed last month – providing much-needed relief for millions of families at the grocery store.

Starting in January, folks on Medicare won’t have to choose between paying their insulin and, in many cases, putting food on the table.
 
Real savings are about to kick in.
History will remember this Administration bringing manufacturing back to America. https://t.co/QXKNRN1GHW

Burn pits the size of football fields that incinerate the wastes of war – like chemicals and fuel – got our servicemembers sick.

The PACT Act will get these veterans the benefits they deserve.
The Biden Express is up and running. https://t.co/Xni8LwdnyF

Passing the PACT Act was a big step to get our veterans the care they need when they come home.

Now, it's time for Congress to pass a bipartisan government funding bill so that we can fully deliver on PACT's promise.

The PACT Act empowers VA to quickly determine if a veteran qualifies for benefits.

It also means new facilities, research, and more workers at VA hospitals.

And for those who've lost a loved one, it means benefits that'll help get them breathing room.

Our veterans are the very spine and the sinew of America.

We owe them.

I'll always show up for them. https://t.co/XP9W7KOLa1

We got the PACT Act done. Now, every veteran or surviving family member deserves to know how to access the benefits of this new law.

I’m urging all veterans to enroll in VA health care to get screened for toxic exposure and to promptly file your claim.

https://t.co/gDiiPR1CfA.

As a nation, we have one truly sacred obligation: to prepare those we send into harm's way and care for them and their families when they come home.

That's why helping toxic-exposed veterans and servicemembers is important to me. It's why I made the PACT Act law.

At the start of our Administration, we inherited multiple historic crises and with narrow margins in Congress.

But we worked fast. Now, jobs and wages are up and inflation and gas prices are coming down. We can see our economic plan working.

We discussed the importance of holding free, fair, and transparent elections, and of working together to strengthen democracy globally.  The United States plans to provide over $165 million to support elections and good governance in Africa in 2023.

Wages have gone up more than prices the last few months.
 
And in a few weeks – starting in January – families will get even more breathing room when our plan to lower drug costs, health insurance premiums, and energy bills goes into effect.

Africa’s prosperity is essential to a better future for all of us.

No matter who you’re rooting for, it was remarkable to watch how much this team has been able to achieve. https://t.co/5kC4zkT1HQ

Ten years ago, 26 Newtown families said goodbye to their loved ones for the last time.

20 first-graders and 6 educators died at the hands of a lone gunman.

We still struggle to fathom such loss. But in this darkness, may we find the strength to finish the work left undone.

The road to this moment has been long. But those who believed in equality never gave up. 

Today is for the Lovings, Edie Windsor and Thea Spyer, the 16 plaintiffs in the Obergefell case, and many others who fought for this.

From me and the entire nation: Thank you.

As Mildred Loving said: previous generations were “bitterly divided over something that should have been so clear and right.”
 
Today, with the signing of the Respect for Marriage Act, we celebrate our progress.
 
There are few things as clear and right as marriage equality. https://t.co/lz9WtQqSsi

Marriage is a simple proposition: who do you love? And will you be loyal to the person you love?
 
It’s not more complicated than that.
 
The Respect for Marriage Act recognizes that everyone should have the right to answer those questions for themselves.

Today is a good day.
 
Today, America takes another step toward equality. Toward liberty and justice not just for some, but for all.
 
Because today, I sign the Respect for Marriage Act into law.
Join the First Lady, Vice President Harris, the Second Gentleman, and me as we host a ceremony on the South Lawn to sign the Respect for Marriage Act. https://t.co/xqklzlC3Aw

Americans can see our economic progress while driving down the street, finding relief at the pump as gas prices fall.
 
As they get ready for holiday celebrations and dinners, food inflation is slowing.

These savings are crucial for so many families.

If there is one message that breaks through from today, it's that this law – and the love it defends – strikes a blow against hate in all its forms.

Celebrate with us as I sign the historic Respect for Marriage Act into law. https://t.co/0NFNNCtVVK

This morning, we received another reason to be optimistic going into the new year.

I’m confident that we can get it done. https://t.co/A2kdI84FIl

A future made in America. https://t.co/szLP1Mdvqu

Getting an updated COVID vaccine is free, easy, and convenient. They’re our best protection this winter.

Think about working for 50 years, tracking every dollar and securing your retirement. Then, you lose half of that pension through no fault of your own.

Gas prices under what they were a year ago.

They see what I see: our world-class, high-skilled, highly-committed labor force.

Well, now we’re sending American-made products overseas made by the best workers in the world.

As for my future with Balenciaga, I am currently re-evaluating my relationship with the brand, basing it off their willingness to accept accountability for something that should have never happened to begin with — & the actions I am expecting to see them take to protect children.

I appreciate Balenciaga’s removal of the campaigns and apology. In speaking with them, I believe they understand the seriousness of the issue and will take the necessary measures for this to never happen again.

As a mother of four, I have been shaken by the disturbing images. The safety of children must be held with the highest regard and any attempts to normalize child abuse of any kind should have no place in our society — period.

I have been quiet for the past few days, not because I haven’t been disgusted and outraged by the recent Balenciaga campaigns, but because I wanted an opportunity to speak to their team to understand for myself how this could have happened.

@TomLankford3 The ocean’s waves, tides, and currents cause it to have highs and lows, similar to hills and valleys. Ocean Topography measures these relative to the geoid, where water height is uniform. Measuring topography helps us to better understand large-scale ocean circulation and tides.

@Ken83867002 The spherical shape of planets and large moons is caused by gravity. They are so massive that their gravity shapes them into spheres. Smaller moons, like Mars’ Phobos and Deimos, don’t have enough gravity to create a spherical shape, leaving them oblong and irregular.

Astronauts Josh Cassada and Frank Rubio have successfully installed Roll-Out Solar Array on the starboard truss structure of the @Space_Station. They have also disconnected a cable allowing restoring a power channel to 75% of its operating capacity. https://t.co/zjBMzACmn0

@mrsgeedeck @Space_Station The astronauts do not recharge or refill their suits during a spacewalk. Instead they are wearing spacesuits that are self-contained units providing everything a spacewalker needs for life support during a spacewalk.

Watch as the newly installed Roll-Out Solar Array deploys on the @Space_Station’s starboard truss structure for the first time. Astronauts Josh Cassada and Frank Rubio are more than five hours into their spacewalk. https://t.co/FcCoRJqeM7

@abibrownman A variety of tethers keep astronauts safely attached to the station as they move back and forth. Other tethers keep the spacewalkers stable and close to the worksite allowing them to use both their hands for different tasks.

Is there water on the Moon? Yes, in the form of ice. Water is critical for future missions, which is why our golf cart-sized VIPER rover will explore the lunar South Pole in search of ice: https://t.co/ipfL0EqmlU https://t.co/vZL3f8Vz66

@abdullah_says17 @MalloryGurecki @NASA_Orion @TwitterSpaces Rockets work because of Newton's third law of motion: for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction. As the rocket pushes the exhaust backward, it makes the rocket move forward. Learn more: https://t.co/w9kDn6yxdI

Regulators, mount up! 🌟

Data from @ChandraXray and @SOFIAtelescope reveal a star cluster that regulates itself—allowing only a limited set of stars to grow before expelling most of the gas from the system. This process likely slows new star creation: https://t.co/T97kdYJlHk https://t.co/Xa5LyOPxdF

Note: @NASA_Orion is now in an expected period with no signal. As with all space communications, we need line of sight to transmit and receive signals, and right now the Moon is between Orion and @NASASCaN Deep Space Network tracking stations. Stay tuned for more live video.

Even though @NASA_Orion is uncrewed, that doesn't mean the spacecraft is empty.

,"Hey there! It's a beautiful day

What are you up to?"
,"It's a great day for some adventure! What's the plan?"
,"What a wonderful day! What do you have planned?"
,"The sun is out and it's a great day for something new! What shall we do?"
,"Time for some fun today! What does your day look like?"
,"Ready for an amazing day? What do you have planned?"
,"It's time to make this day count! What's on the agenda?"
,"The possibilities are endless! What do you want to do today?"
,"Let's make today a great one! What should we do?"
,"Let's turn this day into a memorable experience! What would you like to do?"
,"An adventure awaits! What do you want to explore?"
,"We can make the most of today! What can we do?"
,"Let's make the most of this day! What are some ideas?"
,"A fresh start for a fresh day! What do you have in mind?"
,"Time to make some memories! What's the plan?"
,"It's a perfect day for something new

What do you think?"
,"Let's do something exciting today! Where should we start?"
,"What sort of adventure will we embark on today? Any ideas?"
,"Let's go on an adventure! What should we do?"
,"It's such a beautiful day

We must make the most of it! What should we do first?"
